diff_hunk:
@@ -66,8 +66,8 @@ def step(self, closure=None):
                 state['step'] += 1
 
                 grad = grad.coalesce()  # the update is non-linear so indices must be unique
-                grad_indices = grad._indices()
-                grad_values = grad._values()
+                grad_indices = torch._indices(grad)
body: Ok why don't we (1) remove _indices/_values from C++ (2) add `indices`/`values` (no underscore) in Python and C++ (3) use `tensor.indices` in C++ (4) deprecate `_indices` in Python in favor of `indices`? Or some selection of these 4?
body_html: Ok why don't we (1) remove _indices/_values from C++ (2) add indices/values (no underscore) in Python and C++ (3) use tensor.indices in C++ (4) deprecate _indices in Python in favor of indices? Or some selection of these 4?
body_text: Ok why don't we (1) remove _indices/_values from C++ (2) add indices/values (no underscore) in Python and C++ (3) use tensor.indices in C++ (4) deprecate _indices in Python in favor of indices? Or some selection of these 4?
